p: Medicinal plants are the predominant sources for bioactive compounds used in modern-day drug discoveries and developments [ 5]. Over 80% of drugs on the market shelves currently have their origin in medicinal plants [ 6]. Although plant metabolites exhibit strong physiological activities, their production are not of convenience in terms of quality and productivity due to hysterical environmental conditions and rapid climatic changes [ 7]. Thus, bioprospecting of bioactive metabolites from microorganisms have become a promising alternative route for drug discovery [ 8].
